title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. : edit .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look package build status making changes. README contain badges GitHub Actions used package. recommend tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s). title PR, reference GitHub issue number relates . Keeping changes focussed single issue help minimise time takes review PR.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: contributing guide adapted rOpenSci contributing guide template.

title: Introduction to opendatascot package
text: Use opendatascot download data statistics.gov.scot single line R code. opendatascot removes need write SPARQL code; simply need URI dataset. opendatascot can used interactively, part reproducible analytical pipeline.

title: Introduction to opendatascot package
text: can download entire dataset, filter date /geography. recommend filtering large datasets. require full download large dataset, may need contact statistics.gov.scot. always need last part URI dataset. Find statistics.gov.scot web page dataset (API tab). example, full URI Average Household Size Average Household Size: http://statistics.gov.scot/data/average-household-size just need last part: average-household-size

title: Introduction to opendatascot package
text: last part URI, set dataset parameter ods_dataset():
code: household_size <- ods_dataset(dataset = "average-household-size") head(household_size)

title: Introduction to opendatascot package
text: Filtering useful large data sets. filtering parameters ods_dataset() : geography

title: Introduction to opendatascot package
text: Specify single geography type:
code: household_size_la <- ods_dataset(dataset = "average-household-size",                                            geography = "la") head(household_size_la) sessionInfo() #> R version 4.4.1 (2024-06-14) #> Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu #> Running under: Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS #>  #> Matrix products: default #> BLAS:   /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/openblas-pthread/libblas.so.3  #> LAPACK: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/openblas-pthread/libopenblasp-r0.3.20.so;  LAPACK version 3.10.0 #>  #> locale: #>  [1] LC_CTYPE=C.UTF-8       LC_NUMERIC=C           LC_TIME=C.UTF-8        #>  [4] LC_COLLATE=C.UTF-8     LC_MONETARY=C.UTF-8    LC_MESSAGES=C.UTF-8    #>  [7] LC_PAPER=C.UTF-8       LC_NAME=C              LC_ADDRESS=C           #> [10] LC_TELEPHONE=C         LC_MEASUREMENT=C.UTF-8 LC_IDENTIFICATION=C    #>  #> time zone: UTC #> tzcode source: system (glibc) #>  #> attached base packages: #> [1] stats     graphics  grDevices utils     datasets  methods   base      #>  #> other attached packages: #> [1] opendatascot_0.0.0.9000 #>  #> loaded via a namespace (and not attached): #>  [1] digest_0.6.37     desc_1.4.3        R6_2.5.1          fastmap_1.2.0     #>  [5] xfun_0.48         cachem_1.1.0      knitr_1.48        htmltools_0.5.8.1 #>  [9] rmarkdown_2.28    lifecycle_1.0.4   cli_3.6.3         pkgdown_2.1.1     #> [13] sass_0.4.9        jquerylib_0.1.4   compiler_4.4.1    tools_4.4.1       #> [17] evaluate_1.0.1    bslib_0.8.0       yaml_2.3.10       jsonlite_1.8.9    #> [21] rlang_1.1.4       fs_1.6.4

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joseph Adams. Author, maintainer. Gordon Bryden. Author. Thomas Crines. Author. Alice Hannah. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Adams J, Bryden G, Crines T (2024). opendatascot: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/scotgovanalysis/opendatascot.
code: @Manual{,   title = {opendatascot: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL},   author = {Joseph Adams and Gordon Bryden and Thomas Crines},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/scotgovanalysis/opendatascot}, }

title: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL
text: Use opendatascot download data statistics.gov.scot single line R code. opendatascot removes need write SPARQL code; simply need URI dataset. opendatascot can used interactively, part Reproducible Analytical Pipeline (RAP).

title: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL
text: working within Scottish Government network, can install opendatascot way R packages. easiest way using pkginstaller add-. guidance available eRDM. Alternatively, opendatascot can installed directly GitHub. Note method requires devtools package may work within Scottish Government network. Finally, opendatascot can also installed downloading zip repository running following code, replacing section marked <> (including arrows ) location downloaded zip:
code: devtools::install_github(   "ScotGovAnalysis/opendatascot",   upgrade = "never",   build_vignettes = TRUE ) devtools::install_local(   "<FILEPATH OF ZIPPED FILE>/opendatascot-main.zip",   upgrade = "never",   build_vignettes = TRUE )

title: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL
text: Learn vignette(“opendatascot”) ?ods_dataset. ods_all_datasets() finds datasets currently loaded onto statistics.gov.scot, publisher ods_dataset() returns data dataset statistics.gov.scot ods_structure() finds full sets categories values particular dataset (helpful creating new filters ods_dataset!) ods_print_query() produces SPARQL query used ods_dataset(). ods_find_higher_geography() ods_find_higher_geography() find geographical areas contain, contained specified geography.

title: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL
text: Get dataframe datasets statistics.gov.scot, uri, publisher Discover structure dataset homelessness applications - can use later filter viewing structure, decide want data “-applications” periods “2015/2016” “2016/2017”, add filter. ’re interested particular geographical level, can use “geography” argument return specific levels. Option geography :“dz” - returns datazones “iz” - returns intermediate zones “hb” - returns healthboards “la” - returns local authorities “sc” - returns Scotland whole
code: opendatascot::ods_all_datasets() #> # A tibble: 297 × 3 #>    URI                                                           Name  Publisher #>    <chr>                                                         <chr> <chr>     #>  1 6-in-1-immunisation                                           6-in… Public H… #>  2 adult-disability-payment-applications-and-payments            Adul… Scottish… #>  3 adults-16-64-years-with-low-or-no-qualifications              Adul… Scottish… #>  4 affordable-housing-supply-programme                           Affo… Scottish… #>  5 age-at-first-birth                                            Age … Public H… #>  6 alcohol-related-discharge                                     Alco… Public H… #>  7 alcohol-related-hospital-statistics                           Alco… Public H… #>  8 alcohol-use-ever-among-young-people-salsus                    Alco… Scottish… #>  9 annual-business-survey                                        Annu… Scottish… #> 10 information-and-communication-technologies-ict-including-rel… Annu… Scottish… #> # ℹ 287 more rows opendatascot::ods_structure("homelessness-applications") #> $schemes #> [1] "http://purl.org/linked-data/sdmx/2009/dimension#refArea"   #> [2] "http://purl.org/linked-data/sdmx/2009/dimension#refPeriod" #> [3] "http://purl.org/linked-data/cube#measureType"              #> [4] "http://statistics.gov.scot/def/dimension/applicationType"  #>  #> $categories #> $categories$refArea #>  [1] "West Dunbartonshire"   "West Lothian"          "Scotland"              #>  [4] "Clackmannanshire"      "Dumfries and Galloway" "East Ayrshire"         #>  [7] "East Lothian"          "East Renfrewshire"     "Na h-Eileanan Siar"    #> [10] "Falkirk"               "Highland"              "Inverclyde"            #> [13] "Midlothian"            "Moray"                 "North Ayrshire"        #> [16] "Orkney Islands"        "Scottish Borders"      "Shetland Islands"      #> [19] "South Ayrshire"        "South Lanarkshire"     "Stirling"              #> [22] "Aberdeen City"         "Aberdeenshire"         "Argyll and Bute"       #> [25] "City of Edinburgh"     "Renfrewshire"          "Angus"                 #> [28] "Dundee City"           "East Dunbartonshire"   "Fife"                  #> [31] "Perth and Kinross"     "Glasgow City"          "North Lanarkshire"     #>  #> $categories$refPeriod #>  [1] "2010/2011" "2011/2012" "2012/2013" "2008/2009" "2009/2010" "2007/2008" #>  [7] "2013/2014" "2014/2015" "2015/2016" "2016/2017" "2017/2018" "2018/2019" #> [13] "2019/2020" "2020/2021" "2021/2022" "2022/2023" #>  #> $categories$measureType #> [1] "Count" #>  #> $categories$applicationType #> [1] "All applications"                                     #> [2] "Assessed as homeless or threatened with homelessness" opendatascot::ods_dataset("homelessness-applications",                           applicationType = "all-applications",                           refPeriod = c("2015/2016", "2016/2017")) #> # A tibble: 66 × 5 #>    refArea   refPeriod measureType applicationType  value #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>            <dbl> #>  1 S12000008 2015/2016 count       all-applications   505 #>  2 S12000026 2015/2016 count       all-applications   623 #>  3 S92000003 2015/2016 count       all-applications 34969 #>  4 S12000013 2015/2016 count       all-applications   157 #>  5 S12000048 2015/2016 count       all-applications   898 #>  6 S12000042 2015/2016 count       all-applications  1474 #>  7 S12000006 2015/2016 count       all-applications   668 #>  8 S12000029 2015/2016 count       all-applications  1894 #>  9 S12000014 2015/2016 count       all-applications  1064 #> 10 S12000049 2015/2016 count       all-applications  5977 #> # ℹ 56 more rows opendatascot::ods_dataset("homelessness-applications",                           geography = "la") #> # A tibble: 1,024 × 5 #>    refArea   refPeriod measureType applicationType                         value #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>                                   <dbl> #>  1 S12000033 2010/2011 count       all-applications                         3406 #>  2 S12000014 2010/2011 count       assessed-as-homeless-or-threatened-wit…  1780 #>  3 S12000021 2010/2011 count       assessed-as-homeless-or-threatened-wit…   672 #>  4 S12000027 2010/2011 count       all-applications                          270 #>  5 S12000029 2010/2011 count       assessed-as-homeless-or-threatened-wit…  2323 #>  6 S12000038 2010/2011 count       all-applications                         1253 #>  7 S12000010 2010/2011 count       all-applications                         1192 #>  8 S12000040 2010/2011 count       all-applications                         1932 #>  9 S12000019 2010/2011 count       all-applications                          660 #> 10 S12000020 2010/2011 count       all-applications                          662 #> # ℹ 1,014 more rows

title: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL
text: ’re looking information geographies contained , containing, geographies, two handy functions help - ods_find_lower_geographies() return dataframe geographies contained geography pass ods_find_higher_geographies() return dataframe geographies contain geography pass dataframe can passed ods_dataset get information geographies! just need select vector geography codes, use refArea filter option:
code: all_zones_in_iz <- opendatascot::ods_find_lower_geographies("S02000003") all_zones_in_iz #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   geography description     #>   <chr>     <chr>           #> 1 S01000005 2001 Data Zones #> 2 S01000001 2001 Data Zones #> 3 S01000013 2001 Data Zones #> 4 S01000006 2001 Data Zones #> 5 S01000007 2001 Data Zones #> 6 S01000008 2001 Data Zones #> 7 S01000024 2001 Data Zones opendatascot::ods_dataset("house-sales-prices",                           refArea = all_zones_in_iz$geography,                           measureType = "mean",                           refPeriod = "2013") #> # A tibble: 7 × 4 #>   refArea   refPeriod measureType  value #>   <chr>         <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> #> 1 S01000001      2013 mean        175003 #> 2 S01000005      2013 mean        174404 #> 3 S01000006      2013 mean        195652 #> 4 S01000007      2013 mean        391278 #> 5 S01000008      2013 mean        158028 #> 6 S01000013      2013 mean        174314 #> 7 S01000024      2013 mean        324571

title: Access statistics.gov.scot Without SPARQL
text: package active development, functionality mentioned ’s ready. something important missing, feel free contact contributors add new issue. Since package active development, breaking changes may necessary. make clear package reasonably stable.

title: Geographic Lookup Data — geo_lookup
text: simple lookup data set linking data zones high-level   geographies across Scotland. included geographies account 2001   2011 data zones.

title: Geographic Lookup Data — geo_lookup
code: geo_lookup

title: Geographic Lookup Data — geo_lookup
text: data frame following variables: Datazones: datazone_2001 - 2001 data zone code datazone_2011 - 2011 data zone code Higher geographies: InterZone - Intermediate Geography Zone 2011 MMWard -  Multi-Member Ward Council - Local Authority Code SPConst - Scottish Parliament Constituency CHP - Community Health Partnership HBCode - Health Board Area la_name - Local Authority Name

title: Geographic Lookup Data — geo_lookup
text: Scottish Government, 2015. Data Zone Matching File (Area Pop. based 2001 - 2011) Scottish Government, 2014. Data Zone Intermediate Zone 2011 Lookups

title: Geographic Lookup Data — geo_lookup
text: Data zone geographies periodically reviewed order   accommodate population flows. Usually, done following   availability new census data. order minimise size data set   closest match 2001 data zone kept.

title: Download a dataset — ods_dataset
text: dataset string. identifying final part URI dataset statistics.gov.scot. geography string. valid SG geography code, portion thereof. labelled logical. indicate whether include `refAreaLabelled` column. ... Arbitrary filters requiring valid scheme = value structure.

title: Download a dataset — ods_dataset
text: tibble. invalid arguments used returns NULL warning (see ods_error_message).

title: Download a dataset — ods_dataset
text: ods_dataset returns either complete filtered dataset statistics.gov.scot. dataset parameter must passed valid dataset name (full list can obtained calling ods_all_datasets(). parameters can used filter dataset.

title: Generate a SPARQL query to call on API — ods_print_query
code: ods_print_query(dataset, geography = NULL, labelled = FALSE, ...)

title: Generate a SPARQL query to call on API — ods_print_query
text: dataset string. identifying final part URI dataset statistics.gov.scot. geography string. valid SG geography code, portion thereof. labelled logical. indicate whether include `refAreaLabelled` column. ... Arbitrary filters requiring valid scheme = value structure.

title: Generate a SPARQL query to call on API — ods_print_query
text: string. valid SPARQL query.

title: Generate a SPARQL query to call on API — ods_print_query
text: dataset parameter must passed valid dataset name (full list can obtained calling ods_all_datasets(). parameters can also used filter dataset.

title: Generate a SPARQL query to call on API — ods_print_query
code: ods_print_query("average-household-size") #> [1] "PREFIX qb: <http://purl.org/linked-data/cube#>                 PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>                 PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> select   ?refArea ?refPeriod ?measureType ?value where { ?data qb:dataSet <http://statistics.gov.scot/data/average-household-size>. ?data <http://purl.org/linked-data/sdmx/2009/dimension#refArea> ?refArea. ?data <http://purl.org/linked-data/sdmx/2009/dimension#refPeriod> ?refPeriodURI.      ?refPeriodURI rdfs:label ?refPeriod. ?data <http://purl.org/linked-data/cube#measureType> ?measureType. ?data ?measureType ?value. }"

code: ods_structure("average-household-size") #> $schemes #> [1] "http://purl.org/linked-data/sdmx/2009/dimension#refArea"   #> [2] "http://purl.org/linked-data/sdmx/2009/dimension#refPeriod" #> [3] "http://purl.org/linked-data/cube#measureType"              #>  #> $categories #> $categories$refArea #>  [1] "West Dunbartonshire"   "West Lothian"          "Scotland"              #>  [4] "Clackmannanshire"      "Dumfries and Galloway" "East Ayrshire"         #>  [7] "East Lothian"          "East Renfrewshire"     "Na h-Eileanan Siar"    #> [10] "Falkirk"               "Highland"              "Inverclyde"            #> [13] "Midlothian"            "Moray"                 "North Ayrshire"        #> [16] "Orkney Islands"        "Scottish Borders"      "Shetland Islands"      #> [19] "South Ayrshire"        "South Lanarkshire"     "Stirling"              #> [22] "Aberdeen City"         "Aberdeenshire"         "Argyll and Bute"       #> [25] "City of Edinburgh"     "Renfrewshire"          "Angus"                 #> [28] "Dundee City"           "East Dunbartonshire"   "Fife"                  #> [31] "Perth and Kinross"     "Glasgow City"          "North Lanarkshire"     #>  #> $categories$refPeriod #>  [1] 2004 2003 2005 2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2002 2014 2015 2016 #> [16] 2001 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 #>  #> $categories$measureType #> [1] "Ratio" #>  #>

title: Read SPARQL Query File — read_query_file
text: function searches package content selects sparql   file matching x. file name can passed without   sparql extension.

title: Read SPARQL Query File — read_query_file
code: read_query_file(file_name)

title: Read SPARQL Query File — read_query_file
text: file_name Name SPARQL file source.

text: character scalar.
